node.text:
Mac Marcoux is one of Canada’s most decorated para-athletes. Now, after a year sidelined by injury and skiing with a new, unproven guide, he will attempt to redefine himself as a skier by taking his racing pedigree into Whistler Blackcomb’s extreme alpine terrain. His goal is to do more than just ski lines that are impressive for a blind person, Mac wants to change the way people see adaptive athletes. To do this, he needs the support of his new guide and friend, Tristan Rodgers. If they succeed, Mac will become the world’s first blind freeskier. If they fail, his career as an athlete and his Olympic hopes may come to an end. As the pair square off against the challenges of the mountains and push their boundaries to the limit, they fight to stay healthy and inspired, all while training to earn a spot on the 2022 Olympic Team.

Produced with the support of @telus Optik TV.

node.text:
With the season in sight, we wanted to share a quick refresher: Priority Reservation Days vs. Week-Of Reservation Days. 
 
·  Priority Reservation Days: On Nov. 6, you will be able to make reservations for the core season (Dec. 8 – April 4) across all of our resorts. As a pass holder, you can lock in up to 7 Priority Reservation Days for the core season in advance, and as many week-of reservations during the season as your pass type and availability allow.
 
·  Week-Of Reservation Days: As our resorts start to open for the season, you can also take advantage of exclusive early season access by making week-of reservations. Booking a week-of reservation does not count against your Priority Reservation Days for the core season.  
 
While the first few days will likely see higher volume and extended wait times, there’s no need to rush to lock in your days! We designed this exclusive month-long booking window to accommodate our pass holders' requests before lift tickets go on sale on Dec. 8.
 
Take a sneak peek of our new reservation system above, and see you on the mountain soon! 🏂❄️

node.title: How to Make a Pass Reservation

Throwing it back to our magic movie moment as we take in the best rays of summer… Stan Rey that is. Remember that time one time Whistler Blackcomb made a ski movie? The stoke is real. Here’s our reel…

node.text: For the 4th year in a row, @thenorthface partnered with Whistler Blackcomb to celebrate the return of winter with base camp activities in the village and a night of camping at the top of Whistler Mountain.  Cover photo 📸 @abbydells

node.text:
On Opening Day, @blackcombhelicopters made the morning extra special for the most eager skiers/boarders in the lift line. 
The four lucky guys that camped in the lift line through an especially cold winter night in hopes to be on the first gondola on our Opening Day were surprised with a backcountry helicopter tour through Whistler’s coast mountain range before being dropped off at the Roundhouse Lodge on top of Whistler before any other skiers. 
Who doesn’t like a little help from their friends? 
Congratulations to @wyattripper, @dashiellkm1, @calebchomlack and @alex_sandahl 
#GetTheGoods

node.title: Opening Day Fresh Tracks with Blackcomb Helicopters

node.text:
What is mountain culture? @mikedski, one of Whistler’s original culture creators, explores how Whistler’s unique blend of artists, athletes, and natural environment come together to set this place apart, culminating in world-class events like @wssf.

#OurChoiceDefineUs

node.text:
Working at night is not a popular choice, especially in the mountain. But for Kim Eijdenberg, the Whistler Blackcomb he loves comes to life after the sun has set. Kim’s passion for the moon, the snow, and the stars come alive in one unforgettable mountain top experience.

node.text: Growing up at risk of homelessness, Dakota Williams spent his childhood in the city supporting his sister alongside his mother. He felt trapped, until, at the age of 19, Dakota got the chance to live the years he’d lost and discover a new life in the mountains thanks to @zeroceilingsociety.

node.text:
1070’s lift technology required Jess Turner and her family to live an unlikely life on top of Whistler Mountain. There, Jess made a connection to the majestic environment of the high alpine, a connection she is now proud to share with her family. 
#OurChoicesDefineUs

node.text:
For decades, Wendy Brookbank blazed a trail for women in the mountains as a professional free-skier. Today, she leads men and women alike into Whistler Blackcomb’s most jaw-dropping terrain and helps them reach heights they would never achieve alone. 
#OurChoicesDefineUs

node.text: Transport yourself to an otherworldly destination aboard the NEW Blackcomb Gondola, Whistler Village Gondola, the Guinness World Record-breaking PEAK 2 PEAK Gondola, then set out on a 360 degree experience. Two mountains, hiking trails, vistas that overload the senses, free guided tour in every direction, and an ever changing landscape from snow walls to blooming wildflowers to ancient glaciers.

node.title: The 360 experience: your launchpad to outer spaces

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Whistler Blackcomb on August 16, 2021. May be an image of nature and mountain.

node.text:
Experience Whistler's landscapes in your favourite season. 
Ski for as low as $73 CAD per day with the Whistler Blackcomb Day Pass for 1-10 flexible days.
Click the link in our bio for more information.

📸 @ericbergerphoto

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Whistler Blackcomb on August 13, 2021. May be an image of nature.

node.text:
It's cooler in the alpine 🌡️ ☀️ 

Hotter than normal temperatures continue this weekend so drink plenty of water and find cool spots out of the sunshine. 

Summer sightseeing continues daily until September 6th. Blackcomb Gondola is operating daily for sightsee access. Whistler Village Gondola is now spinning from Friday to Sunday only.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Whistler Blackcomb on August 12, 2021. May be an image of nature.

node.text:
Winter daydreaming may soon become excessive. ❄️ ❄️ 

The season is fast approaching and it won’t be long until our alpine playground is looking like this again. 

📷 @gnarstie

node.text:
Unlock more of the mountain with ski or snowboard lessons, now available for purchase. ⛷️ 🏂 
If you're looking to drop into our mountains with confidence, the best place to start is by booking a lesson with one of our experienced, top-level guides. Ski and ride lessons are available now, so now's the time to commit to adventure next winter.
Visit the Snow School page on the official Whistler Blackcomb website for more information. 
📷 @andrewstrain

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Whistler Blackcomb on August 06, 2021. May be an image of outdoors.

node.text: Take a ride through the skies. Our glass bottom gondolas will be spinning all weekend as part of our one-of-a-kind PEAK 2 PEAK sightseeing experience.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Whistler Blackcomb on August 05, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and drink.

node.text: Ceasar, Corona or both? You decide. Come and see Nick, Aubrey and Dan shaking things up this weekend at Whistler's Umbrella Bar. Enjoy a drink with a view from 11am until 5pm Friday, Saturday and Sunday on Whistler Mountain.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Whistler Blackcomb in Whistler Blackcomb. May be an image of nature, tree and mountain.

node.text: Walk among giants. Explore Whistler Mountain via Peak Express Chair, running Friday - Sunday this week.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Whistler Blackcomb in Whistler Blackcomb. May be an image of ski slope and nature.

node.text: Winter can't come soon enough. Did we mention that pass prices are now reduced 20%? Get ready for the season and buy your pass today. 📷 @ericbergerphoto

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Whistler Blackcomb in Whistler Blackcomb with @thenorthface, @thenorthface_trail, @trailforks, and @thenorthfacewhistler. May be an image of nature and tree.

node.text: Take on @thenorthface Ascent Trail Challenge on Blackcomb starting August 1. Record your time via the @trailforks app for a chance to win The North Face gear. 📸 @gnarstie @thenorthfacewhistler @thenorthface_trail

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Whistler Blackcomb in Whistler Blackcomb. May be an image of bridge and nature.

node.text: Dare to walk the plank? Come up to the peak of Whistler Mountain and explore the Raven's Eye, open this August long weekend including Monday.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Whistler Blackcomb in Whistler Blackcomb with @gnarstie. May be an image of nature.

node.text: Take a lift to the top of Whistler Mountain this BC Day. Peak Express will be operating Friday, Saturday, Sunday AND Monday for the August long weekend. Operating hours on Monday will be 11am - 4pm.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Whistler Blackcomb in Whistler Blackcomb. May be an image of tree and nature.

node.text: Winter will be here before you know it. Start planning your winter escape. Book by 7/31 for the best rates on lodging. #bookwinterearly 📸 @wintonphotos
